publicationStmt.authority: Centre for Computing in the Humanities, King's College London

availability.p: All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://inslib.kcl.ac.uk/

div.p: In preparing this edition, the team has drawn on previous experienc: Bodard, Reynold and Roueché woked together on publishing the online corpora of the Inscriptions of Aphrodisias; Bodard worked on the Ancient Inscriptions of the Northern Black Sea. The new corpus is presented as a series of documents; but as part of the project we have created and published the Heritage Gazetteer of Libya, to which the corpus refers. We have worked in close co-operation with t the Inscriptions of Greek Cyrenaica/Greek Verse Inscriptions of Cyrenaica project, to our mutual benefit.
Reynolds, Roueché, Bodard; editorial work by Dobias-Lalou
Valentina Asciutti, Pietro Liuzzo, Gillian B, Claudia Greco, Charlotte Tupman MGDA, AIO, Paolo, Ljuba,ΜΡ, MLA, MR
